hints.text: In Java, variables must be declared with a data type before use. The basic syntax is: type variableName; followed by assignment: variableName = value;
Primitive data types in Java include int (integers), double (decimal numbers), String (text), and boolean (true/false). Use int for whole numbers, double for numbers with decimals.
To declare and initialize a variable: int age = 25; To perform arithmetic: int sum = age + 10; Use System.out.println() to print results to the console.
